message: I understand the concerns of Rio Copa Foods regarding the non-compete period. However, a 10-year non-compete period would ensure market stability and allow us to fully integrate and optimize the operations. This would ultimately benefit both parties in the long run. Can we agree on a 10-year non-compete period?

[You] [offer]
Thank you for your understanding. However, a 10-year non-compete period is too long for us. We believe a shorter period would be more beneficial for both parties. We propose a non-compete period of 3 years. This would allow us to re-enter the market sooner, while still giving you ample time to establish your operations. Can we agree on a 3-year non-compete period?

[You] [offer]
I appreciate your perspective on the non-compete period. However, a longer period would ensure a smoother transition and provide us with the necessary time to establish our operations effectively. This would ultimately lead to a more stable market and greater benefits for both parties. How about we meet in the middle and agree on a non-compete period of 7 to 8 years? This would still give Rio Copa Foods a reasonable time frame to re-enter the market.

I understand your need for a smooth transition and market stability. However, a 7 to 8-year non-compete period is still too long for us. We are willing to show flexibility and propose a non-compete period of 2 years. This would still provide you with sufficient time to establish your operations, while allowing us to re-enter the market in a reasonable time frame. Can we agree on a 2-year non-compete period?
